You can learn about the feature of delayed messages through the documentation, and maybe the usage of setDelayTimeLevel will be clearer.
https://github.com/apache/rocketmq/blob/master/docs/en/Feature.md

__STARTDELIVERTIME is not used in the community version.
I will close this issue, and you can reopen it at any time if you have any questions.

> __STARTDELIVERTIME is not used in the community version. I will close this issue, and you can reopen it at any time if you have any questions.

ok, thank you!
Could you submit a PR to resolve it?
Statistics at the queue level are only for delayed messages.

> Is it necessary to add a switch only for the statistics of the 18 levels of delayed messages?

I would like use one switch to disable all debug stats (eg: queue level GROUP_GET_FALL_SIZE), the enableQueueStat should rename.
I have fixed a related problem in go sdk PR https://github.com/apache/rocketmq-client-go/issues/733

link #3644

In 4.6.60 version, add lite pull consumer support for RocketMQ：
(1) Support consume messages in subscribe way with auto rebalance.
(2) Support consume messages in assign way with no auto rebalance support.
(3) Add seek/commit offset for a specified message queue.

DefaultLitePullConsumer can be regarded as improved version of DefaultMQPullConsumer, so it is still message pull mode, and you need to implement consumption retry by yourself. Like using kafka, you can seek specific offset in message queue for retry.

Only DefaultMQPushConsumer in CLUSTERING model providers consumption retry machanism.
